cyclone.name: JERRY
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest, forecast to pass well north of Puerto Rico on Saturday, then curve northwest and north over the western Atlantic toward Bermuda
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: No landfall expected – Jerry remains over open Atlantic waters

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watches are in effect only for St. Maarten, St. Martin, and St. Barthelemy
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands and Atlantic waters north of Puerto Rico; Bermuda later in the period
weather_observation.wind: Outer rain bands may bring occasional gusts to near tropical-storm force, but sustained 34-kt winds are unlikely (≤3% probability).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; storm stays well north of Puerto Rico.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain (isolated 3 inches) possible as outer bands brush the island Saturday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along north-facing beaches beginning late Friday and continuing through Saturday.
